recipes.name: Aubergine Curry
ingredients: 3 tsp garam masala or curry powder
methods: Slice up the aubergines and tofu into cubes
Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes
Dice onions and garlic and sauté until soft/translucent
Add spices, veg stock cube and water to deglaze the pan. Bring to a simmer.
Add peanut/almond butter and coconut milk and allow it to melt.
Add the aubergines and the cubed tofu into the pot and submerge
Cook for 10-15 minutes on a low heat.
Add soy sauce and sugar and combine adjust flavours with salt and pepper.

recipes.name: Baba Ganoush
methods: Cook the aubergines in the oven face down for 30 minutes
Take the aubergines out and scoop the flesh out with a spoon into a bowl, discard the skin
Add all ingredients into the bowl and combine with a fork
Using scissors, make rough cuts to the aubergine mix to reach your desired consistency. I like quite a fine texture but with still bits of aubergine for texture
notes: You can also use a blender to combine all the ingredients but I prefer to use scissors to have different textures in the dish

recipes.name: Chana Masala
ingredients: 2 green chillies (stemmed and seeded to taste)
methods: Combine half the onions (0.5 if using 1, so forth), ginger, coriander, garlic and chillies to a food processor for about 20 seconds.
Transfer mix to pot with cold/room temperature oil.
Bring pot to a medium heat for about 5 minutes.
In the meantime, add the tomatoes to a food processor for about 30 seconds
Add chilli powder, cumin, turmeric and fennel seeds to the pan and combine.
Add chickpeas and tomato blend to the pot.
Stir, lower the heat, close and let it cook for about 15 minutes
Add garam masala and salt at this stage.
Let it cook for another 8 minutes.
Cool down and serve with some rice, chapati or your carb of choice.
Garnish with coriander, diced onion and some green chillies.

recipes.name: Cilantro lime noodles
ingredients: 1 tbsp red pepper flakes (mild/hot) - i used gochugaru
methods: Boil knife cut noodles according to package instructions and rinse with cold water.
Combine gochugaru with cilantro.
Add heated sesame oil to the mixture.
Add the rest of the ingredients and give it a good mix.
Pour over noodles, mix and top with toasted sesame seeds.
Heat it up gently, and it's ready to serve!

recipes.name: Lemon Cashew Pasta
ingredients: 1 handful of fresh herbs (parsley and basil)
methods: Soak the cashews in hot water for at least 10 minutes.
In a pan, sauté the onion until translucent, then add the garlic, parsley stems, and lemon zest and cook for a few more minutes.
Deglaze the pan with a splash of lemon juice to release all the flavors.
Blend the soaked cashews, veggie broth, nutritional yeast, and lemon juice in a blender or food processor to make the sauce
Pour the sauce back into the pan and add some fresh herbs such as parsley or basil.
Cook the pasta according to the packaging instructions until al dente, then save some pasta water
Add the cooked pasta to the sauce, mix well, and add pasta water until it reaches your desired consistency.

recipes.name: Pasta with Pistachio Pesto
ingredients: 70 g pistachios (or more for a more prominent flavor)
methods: Toast the nuts and seeds until slightly browned from all sides.
Blend all ingredients for the pesto/sauce. Blend it as fine or coarse as you like.
Cook the pasta according to packaging instructions.
Add the pesto/sauce to a pan, loosen with some pasta water, then add in the pasta.
Serve with some crushed pistachios and vegan parmesan - enjoy!

recipes.name: Roasted Red Pepper and Cashew Pasta
ingredients: 50 g sun-dried tomatoes in oil, drained
1 handful of fresh basil for topping
1 tbsp of toasted cashews for topping
1 tsp of red chilli flakes for topping
methods: Preheat the oven to 230°C fan / 400°F.
Transfer the cashews to a bowl and cover in hot water straight from a kettle. Leave to one side to soak.
Add the red peppers to a roasting tray and roast for 15 minutes.
Remove the tray from the oven. Add the quartered onions and garlic cloves and return to the oven for another 15 minutes.
Cook the pasta in boiling salted water as per packet instructions and make sure you reserve some pasta water.
Leave the roasted veggies to cool for 5 minutes. Then peel the onion and garlic, and remove any skin, stalks, and seeds from the red peppers. Transfer them to a blender.

Drain the cashews and add them to the blender, along with the plant-based milk, 250ml (1 cup) of pasta water you reserved earlier, dried mixed herbs, sun-dried tomatoes (drain as much oil as possible), balsamic vinegar, nutritional yeast, and very generous pinches of salt and pepper. Blend until smooth.
Pour the sauce into a large saucepan on a low-medium heat. Gently heat the sauce, then add the spaghetti.
Top with basil, toasted cashews, and chilli flakes.

recipes.name: Red Lentil Dahl
ingredients: 1 tablespoon olive oil, or use water for sautéing to make the recipe oil-free
2 tablespoons fresh ginger, finely chopped or grated
1 teaspoon red chili pepper flakes, add up to a teaspoon extra if you like it spicy. You can use 1 fresh small red chili if you prefer
2 teaspoons salt, plus more to taste at the end
1 teaspoons ground black pepper, plus more to taste at the end
400 grams of dried split red lentils, (no need to soak - but maybe rinse)
methods: Combine all spices into a spice mix.
Put oil in a pot, once hot, add onions.
Once the onions have browned, add garlic and ginger and cook until fragrant (add more oil if necessary).
Add the spice mix into the pot and stir until combined.
Add 3 cups of water to the pot and mix, make sure to scratch the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon to avoid burning at the bottom.
Add the red lentils, tomatoes, and coconut milk to the pot.
Bring the mix to a boil and stir throughout.
Once boiling, bring down to a simmer, cover and let it cook for 15-20 minutes.

recipes.name: The Smoothest Hummus
methods: Boil some salted water, add the chickpeas and garlic into the water, but keep the chickpea brine separate.
Boil the chickpeas for 20 minutes to half an hour.
Drain the chickpeas once cooked and add to a blender with the chickpea brine and garlic clove from earlier.
Blend until they form a paste-like consistency.
Add in the tahini and blend, then whilst blending add in the ice cubes one at a time.
Add in the cumin, olive oil, salt, and lemon juice and blend one last time or until it's as smooth as desired.
Plate up the hummus, drizzle some olive oil over it and season with fresh parsley.

recipes.name: Vegan Thai Tom Yum Soup
ingredients: 3 slices fresh galangal or ginger with pepper
3 tbsp of soy sauce or vegan fish sauce
1 tbsp red chili paste/sauce (I use Sambal Oelek)
methods: With a pestle and mortar (ideally) crack lemongrass stalk
With a pesttle and mortar crush garlic and chiles
Prepare galangal, onions, tomatoes, mushrooms and baby corn
Heat a large pot over medium high heat, add oil and sauté onion and aromatics
Bring water to a boil in a separate pot and cook noodles to their specification, drain once they're ready
Add water and veg stock cubes to the pot and boil
Add mushrooms, baby corn, tomatoes, sugar, fish or soy sauce and salt to taste
Simmer for 5 minutes
Mix in lime juice, coconut milk and chili paste/sauce
Cook soup for another 7-8 minutes for flavors to infuse
(optional) Remove inedible aromatics
Serve hot with more lime juice and cilantro if desired
notes: Squeeze lime juice to squeeze for garnish
For the rice noodles I use the Udon Noodles by Yutaka (https://yutaka.london/products/noodles/udon-noodles-250g/)
If not using babycorn, feel free to replace babycorn for more mushrooms
I like to cook the soup and noodles separately to have the option to have the soup on its own or with noodles
